title: Offer address autofill at checkout
summary: Reduce friction by offering secure address autofill.

examples.good: Single-page checkout with inline validation and browser autofill.
examples.bad: Multi-step flow requiring account before autofill is available.

title: Provide helpful empty states for zero results
summary: Guide users with suggestions when no results are found.

examples.good: ‘No results — try removing filters’ + quick suggestions.

title: Show breadcrumbs on deep pages
summary: Help users understand where they are and go back quickly.

examples.good: Collapsed breadcrumb on small screens, expandable on tap.
examples.bad: Breadcrumbs that scroll horizontally without indicators.

title: Provide inline validation for form fields
summary: Help users correct mistakes faster by validating as they type.
donts: Only show errors after full form submission

examples.good: ‘Password must include 8+ characters, 1 uppercase, 1 number’ shown in real time.
examples.bad: Form reloads with generic 'Password error' at the top.

title: Ensure mobile tap targets are large enough
summary: Buttons and links should be comfortable to tap without zooming.

examples.good: Large primary CTA button with 16px padding.
examples.bad: Clustered inline links with no spacing.

title: Give users feedback during content loading
summary: Show skeletons, spinners, or messages so users know the system is working.

examples.good: Skeleton cards displayed until content loads.
examples.bad: White screen with no indicator for 5+ seconds.
